intro: Atylosia candicans, commonly known as the showy goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, gray-green leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Atylosia candicans is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
